intro: Tsuga formosana, commonly known as the Formosan hemlock, is a species of conifer native to Taiwan. It is a medium-sized tree that typically grows to a height of 15–20 meters. The tree has slender, drooping branches and dark green, needle-like leaves that are arranged spirally along the stems. Its cones are small and typically hang downward, containing two to three seeds. The Formosan hemlock plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat for various wildlife species.
